job_description:
Eindhoven
Do you want to join TMC Physics as a R&D Engineer Optics. Then you are the person we are looking for!

| Your challenges?

The mission of a R&D Engineer Optics is to apply your expertise for different industries in order to drive innovation. You can work with different techniques to o design lasers, build telescopes, create fiber optics communication systems, and much more. Thus, you put in practice at the R&D department of our clients in the High-Tech Industry. As a R&D Engineer Optics you are responsible for the design, development, characterization or testing of optical systems. You will work in R&D environments on various application areas: projection, illumination, lighting applications, wafer optics, photonics.
| What do we expect from you?
MSc or PhD in (theoretical) physics, applied mathematics, scientific computing or comparable background
Experience in both the theoretical and experimental part
Industrial experience in optical fibers, optical engineer and design, water optics
Experience with modeling, numerical methods, data analysis
Experience with a combination of the following: Matlab, Zemax, LightTools, LabVIEW
Good oral and written communicative skills;
Stress resistant, team player and strong personality;
Serious motivation for the Employeneurship model of TMC.
| What does our Business Cell have to offer?
The Employeneurs of TMC Physics are strongly driven by content. TMC Physics Employeneurs are internationally orientated, come from different cultures and are critical by nature. These are traits our customers like to put to their advantage. Within the team of physics competences in the field of computational physics, thermal and flow, optics/instrumentation/vision and plasma physics are represented among others.
| What can you expect from TMC?
TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world.
At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in. We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career.
As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture.
| Why choose for Employeneurship?
We are truly unique thanks to our Employeneurship model which is a true innovation for the High Technology consulting business. It is the business relationship of the 21th century for high skilled technical professionals. It is built around 5 main pillars:
You will have a permanent employment contract, offering you stability and security
You will get to know your market value and have a share in the profit your work generates thanks to the individual profit sharing
We will support you with a one-on-one coaching and trainings designed to help you develop your entrepreneurial skills
The competence cells structure, provides you with a strong meaningful and relevant network
The entrepreneurial lab: a playground for new ideas and a potential launching for start-ups
TMC is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.


Feel Free to Contact
Bram Thelen
Director Data Science | Nanotechnology | Physics, Netherlands
Tel: +31 (0)6 52 89 25 70

job_description:
Eindhoven
In your role as Laboratory Technician & (Cleanroom) Equipment Engineer you are responsible for the management organization and optimal operation of laboratories and cleanrooms, and various equipment for thin film deposition of the Thin Film Electronics departments of our customers.

| YOUR CHALLENGES?

Your daily activities will be very diverse and consist of the daily organization and support of our researchers, coordination with relevant external stakeholders (suppliers of equipment, external installation parties) and technical maintenance of installations and equipment.
Keeping laboratories and cleanrooms operational, including specific thin film equipment.
Assistance with the purchase and installation of new equipment and the associated repair and maintenance strategy.
Pro-actively support the process engineering team with regard to operational aspects of laboratory and cleanroom facilities and process equipment
| WHAT DO WE EXPECT FROM YOU?

You are well acquainted with processes that take place in a laboratory and preferably with (deposition) equipment for thin film technology (sputter tools, gloveboxes, slot die coaters, etc.). You will work in a diverse, international team with colleagues with multidisciplinary knowledge and know-how from a wide range of backgrounds.

In your role you are part of the technical heart of the laboratories, and you will have to deal with many internal stakeholders. Therefore, good technical skills and communication skills are indispensable.

What else you bring:

You have BSc degree and relevant working experience
Experience with the technical environment (laboratories, cleanrooms) and maintenance of equipment in a high-tech laboratory environment, preferably in a comparable role.
Demonstrated affinity with working in a physical/chemical research environment.
You are a proactive, pragmatic and solution-oriented team player.
Good command of the Dutch and English language.

| WHAT DOES OUR BUSINESS CELL HAVE TO OFFER?

TMC Nanotechnology consists of a close team of over 25 nanotechnologists with different levels of experience and background. Your colleagues will form the inner circle of you professional network, support you to find opportunities for yourself and facilitate your personal growth. Together with our Business manager we have a strong view on the nanotechnology market and demands.

Nanotechnologists at TMC are focusing on nanomaterials, thin films and nano- and microdevice development and production. With our expertise we help clients with project that have a strong impact in society.

Our multidisciplinary, pragmatic and entrepreneurial way of working provide innovative solutions for projects ranging from, design to research and development up to new product introduction.

| WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM TMC?

TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world.

At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in. We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career.

As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture.

| WHY CHOOSE FOR EMPLOYENEURSHIP?

We are truly unique thanks to our Employeneurship model which is a true innovation for the High Technology consulting business. It is the business relationship of the 21th century for high skilled technical professionals. It is built around 5 main pillars:

You will have a permanent employment contract, offering you stability and security
You will get to know your market value and have a share in the profit your work generates thanks to the individual profit sharing
We will support you with a one-on-one coaching and trainings designed to help you develop your entrepreneurial skills
The competence cells structure, provides you with a strong meaningful and relevant network
The entrepreneurial lab: a playground for new ideas and a potential launching for start-ups

TMC is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Feel Free to Contact
Bram Thelen
Director Data Science | Nanotechnology | Physics, Netherlands
Tel: +31 (0)6 52 89 25 70

job_description:
Netherlands
Als Senior Process Engineer help je onze klant bij het ontwikkelen en fabriceren van hun nano- en micro-technologie producten door je handen toe te passen op technische kennis. en vaardigheden in multidisciplinaire teams.

| Je uitdaging?

Onze klanten werken aan de toonaangevende fabricagetechnologieën in de nanotechnologie-industrie binnen Nederland. In je rol als werkondernemer ondersteun je de ontwikkeling van deze technologieën door de juiste behandeling, verbetering en ontwikkeling van machines en processen.
| Wat verwachten wij van jou?
Jij hebt:
Een technische MSc opleiding gevolgd, in een van de volgende of vergelijkbare vakgebieden: nanotechnologie, materiaalkunde, toegepaste natuurkunde, oppervlakte-, plasma- or materiaal fysics;
Minimaal 5 jaar relevante werkervaring in de industrie;
Kennis in het opzetten van machines en processen binnen een high tech omgeving;
Een afgeronde Green Belt of Black Belt certificering is een pré;
Ervaring met dunne film processen, nano- and micro-devices fabricage, of vergelijkbare toepassingen.

Verder beschik je over goede interpersoonlijke vaardigheden, die je kunt toepassen in de interactie met klanten en ben je accuraat, flexibel en veerkrachtig.
| Wat heeft TMC Nanotechnology jou te bieden?
Werkondernemers van TMC Nanotechnology richten zich op de schaal van nano- tot micrometergrootte en weten dat hun expertise de wereld zal veranderen. Materialen en processen op zo een kleine schaal te vertalen naar toepassingen in de echte wereld – hier ligt de kracht van onze werkondernemers. Hun multidisciplinaire, pragmatische en ondernemende manier van werken biedt innovatieve oplossingen voor projecten variërend van ontwerp tot onderzoek en ontwikkeling tot introductie van nieuwe producten.
| Wat kan je van TMC verwachten?
TMC is een internationaal hightech kennishuis dat expertise naar hun klanten brengt om hen te ondersteunen bij het realiseren van hun technologische uitdagingen. Als zodanig opereert TMC als een expertisecentrum ter beschikking van haar klanten en helpen we hen om concurrerender te zijn in een steeds globalere en sneller veranderende technologische wereld.
Bij TMC geloven we dat mensen de drijvende kracht zijn achter technologische innovatie. Daarom willen we de best mogelijke omstandigheden creëren waarin tech-talenten kunnen gedijen. We bieden je een uitdagende en stimulerende werkomgeving waarin je de regisseur van je eigen carrière kunt zijn.
Als Employeneur maak je deel uit van onze TMC-familie. Naast onze uitstekende technische expertise zijn plezier en betrokkenheid betekenisvolle onderdelen van onze cultuur.
| Waarom werkondernemerschap?
De term Employeneurship klinkt misschien onbekend. Dat komt omdat wij de bedenkers zijn. Het is meer dan een woord, het is een werkwijze, een paradigma zelfs. Bij Employeneurship denk en handel je in principe als een ondernemer, maar vanuit de veilige positie van een werknemer. Het is echter in de eerste plaats een manier om voortdurend in ontwikkeling te blijven en het biedt je de kans om je carrière daadwerkelijk te sturen.
Employeneurship is gebaseerd op 5 basisprincipes:
Een duurzame werkrelatie met een vast dienstverband
Individuele winstdeling: je leert je marktwaarde kennen en hebt een aandeel in de winst die je werk genereert
YOUniversity: we zullen je ondersteunen met een-op-een coaching en trainingen
Businesscellen: voor een sterk en relevant netwerk
The Entrepreneurial Lab (TEL): een speeltuin voor nieuwe ideeën en een potentiële lancering voor start-ups

TMC is een werkgever die gelijke kansen biedt en waarde hecht aan diversiteit. We discrimineren niet op basis van ras, religie, kleur, nationale afkomst, geslacht, seksuele geaardheid, leeftijd, burgerlijke staat, veteranenstatus of handicapstatus.

Feel Free to Contact

job_description:
Eindhoven
As thin film process engineer you develop and optimize the production process for thin films in a large volume production setting for one of our clients.

| Your challenges?

You should have extensive thin film technology knowledge and actively contribute to the development of processes for new membranes, including the industrialization, and help to steer the process maturity improvements needed for manufacturing of existing membranes.

For the development of new thin film manufacturing processes definition of DOE’s, conducting experiments, characterization of layers/stacks and definition of follow-up investigations are part of the activities.

For the steering of the process development of thin film membranes and the industrialization of the manufacturing process of these membranes process analysis and product-process relation investigations are required; including assessment of process capability and control

Support and guide the development and industrialization of deposition technologies for extremely thin layers/stacks, structuring of these layers while providing the desired functionality.

Effectively use characterization methods to measure/characterize membrane films during the stages of the manufacturing process and correlate analysis results with the product performance.

Evaluation of the product performance of the membranes by functional testing.

Process development and industrialization is achieved by (guiding of) experimental testing, possibly at external facilities, and in cooperation with external partners in combination with extensive analysis.
| What do we expect from you?
Min. MSc or PhD, material science, physical chemistry/physics with affinity for thin film technology
More than 12 years experience in thin film process development and manufacturing, post educational journey completion.
Extensive operational experience in process manufacturing (factory-setup understanding) and industrialization
High knowledge level on Thin film technology and materials (properties, processing, interfaces)
Ability to cover process development ranging from research phase, development phase, pilot production to ramp up in high volume production
Sound knowledge level on material characterization and metrology
Familiar with high tech production processes, e.g. semiconductors, displays
Working in a multi-disciplinary, multi-cultural environment is a second nature
Preferably has experience in a project where activities covered all the way from (a) supplier(s) to the end user
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:
Broad technical view, ability to oversee the impact of processing details on a product
Drive for manufacturability and robustness
Able to drive forward the technical progress
Can work independently in a dynamic, explorative environment
Strong analytical ability with a pragmatic attitude
Highly committed and flexible
Robust personality
Team player
Good communicational skills and knowledge of English.
Able to see the bigger picture
Willingness for occasional travel to our international offices.
| What does our Business Cell have to offer?

TMC Nanotechnology consists of a close team of over 25 nanotechnologists with different levels of experience and background. Your colleagues will form the inner circle of you professional network, support you to find opportunities for yourself and facilitate your personal growth. Together with our Business manager we have a strong view on the nanotechnology market and demands.

Nanotechnologists at TMC are focusing on nanomaterials, thin films and nano- and microdevice development and production. With our expertise we help clients with project that have a strong impact in society.
Our multidisciplinary, pragmatic and entrepreneurial way of working provide innovative solutions for projects ranging from, design to research and development up to new product introduction.

| What can you expect from TMC?

TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world.

At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in. We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career.
As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture.
| Why choose for Employeneurship?

We are truly unique thanks to our Employeneurship model which is a true innovation for the High Technology consulting business. It is the business relationship of the 21th century for high skilled technical professionals. It is built around 5 main pillars:

You will have a permanent employment contract, offering you stability and security
You will get to know your market value and have a share in the profit your work generates thanks to the individual profit sharing
We will support you with a one-on-one coaching and trainings designed to help you develop your entrepreneurial skills
The competence cells structure, provides you with a strong meaningful and relevant network
The entrepreneurial lab: a playground for new ideas and a potential launching for start-ups


TMC is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Feel Free to Contact
Thies Oosterwijk
Business manager Nanotechnology, Netherlands
Tel: +31 (0)6 54 93 80 45

job_description:
Eindhoven
Metrology orchestrates the behavior of powerful system modules, so that together they achieve an extraordinary combination of speed and accuracy. This is why we are looking for modelling experts who are experts in requirements engineering and challenged by translating functional requirements into lean functional designs. So are you someone that combines strong analytical reasoning and conceptual understanding with excellent communication skills.

| Your challenges?

With TMC Physics, a Junior Modelling Expert applies its analytical skills on complex physical-technical problems, social or financial systems. This can range from developing, modifying and validating models to applying these models (both analytical and numerical). The work will mainly be conducted in project teams of various (technical) disciplines. It is crucial that you have a good overview of the possible applications of your expertise and that you’re able to motivate this to others.

| What do we expect from you?
MSc or PhD in (theoretical) physics, applied mathematics, scientific computing or comparable background;
Proficiency experience with C, C++, Matlab and/or Python;
At least >1 years experience in the high tech industry;
Proven experience and affinity with modeling of physical-technical problems, risk modeling, image processing and / or data analysis;
Good oral and written communicative skills;
Stress resistant, team player and strong personality;
Serious motivation for the Employeneurship model of TMC.
| What does our Business Cell have to offer?

The Employeneurs of TMC Physics are strongly driven by content. TMC Physics Employeneurs are internationally orientated, come from different cultures and are critical by nature. These are traits our customers like to put to their advantage. Within the team of physics competences in the field of computational physics, thermal and flow, optics/instrumentation/vision and plasma physics are represented among others.

| What can you expect from TMC?

TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world.

| Why choose for Employeneurship?

job_description:
Portfolio Manager -Health
Business Development - Eindhoven | More than two weeks ago
Drive imec’s offering for a portfolio of technologies in the life science, medtech or wearable/digital health markets.
What you will do
In this job, you will be responsible to define and help realize imec’s strategy towards maximum impact for a portfolio of technologies and solutions in the Health domain. In the coming years the Health portfolio will extend in areas like (medical) implants, ingestibles (eg. Sensor pills), neurostimulation and potentially some other applications. This spans the journey from market analysis, over requirement and roadmap definition, business plan creation to contributing to its execution. Your main responsibilities will be to:

Shape imec’s offering strategy for your portfolio, driving research investments and solution roadmaps from market needs in life science, medtech and wearable/digital health applications, in close collaboration with imec’s management, technology teams and your colleagues in the business development and field teams:
Identify, assess, and synthesize market trends and gaps relevant towards imec’s Health roadmap and offering definition.
Articulate USPs of imec technologies from an application perspective and how they fit in potential customers’ value chains.
Analyze competitive and intellectual property landscapes.
Assess financial impact and potential of proposed investments to support go/no-go decisions and prioritization.
Define business models and collaboration approaches bridging imec’s offering to the needs and capabilities of the customers. This may involve building partnerships with 3rd parties or spin-offs to turn imec’s technologies or solutions in actual products.
Validate the above and empathize with imec partners’ needs through effective Voice-of-Customer insight collection.
Act as business lead for ongoing investments towards new assets in the portfolio:
Develop, monitor and update the strategic vision and business case behind the investment decision.
Derive high-level specifications and plans coherent with the stated product-market fit and market timing.
Monitor execution and market risks and help manage potential barriers such as clinical trials and regulatory approvals.
Sign off investment milestones and requests for specification changes in view of the (updated) business case.
Set release-to-market conditions and lead hand-over towards field and business development teams.
Support the commercial phase for collaborations within the portfolio:
Support field teams in customer discovery and strategy alignment efforts (incl. make-a-thons, brainstorming, workshops etc.).
Support business development teams towards the execution of the portfolio business plan (and to analyze deviations).
Evangelize the portfolio in relevant industry conferences, congresses, or customer meetings.
Make portfolio offering and business case adjustments based on market feedback.
What we do for you
We offer you the opportunity to join one of the world’s premier research centers in nanotechnology at its location in Eindhoven, The Netherlands. With your talent, passion and expertise, you’ll become part of a team that makes the impossible possible. Together, we shape the technology that will determine the society of tomorrow.
We are proud of our open, multicultural, and informal working environment with ample possibilities to take initiative and show responsibility. We commit to supporting and guiding you in this process, not only with words but also with tangible actions. Through imec.academy, 'our corporate university', we actively invest in your development to further your technical and personal growth.

We are aware that your valuable contribution makes imec a top player in its field. Imec The Netherlands, as an employer of choice, offers you an attractive compensation and benefits package including a 100% employer paid pension plan and flexible working hours. Furthermore, imec-NL offers a wide range of training possibilities.
Who you are
You hold a scientific degree (engineering, biomedical or clinical) & and have a solid business background.
You have at least 10 years experience in a product marketing, strategy setting, business development or similar role in a high-tech environment and have a deep understanding of at least one key market segment relevant to imec’s health offering.
You are familiar with applications like (medical) implants, ingestibles (eg. Sensor pills), neurostimulation.
You are multi-disciplinary, highly collaborative, passionate about technology and have entrepreneurial drive to get them adopted.
You are familiar with business analytics, financial tools and innovation management best practices for product marketing.
You are an analytical, strategic and inspirational multi-tasker yet decisive and able to set priorities when the facts are in.
You are comfortable doing technical deep dives together with the technical teams or to refine market needs.
You have excellent communication skills (English) and ability to influence stakeholders (internal and external).
Interested

Are you interested in this position and do you want to learn more about it, then you can talk to Frank Wolfs, Talent Acquisition Lead imec NL. You can reach Frank via +31(0)6-50837563. If you wish to apply then please submit your full resume and a motivational letter.
Click on ‘apply’ to submit your application. You will then be redirected to e-recruiting.

Who we are

Program Manager - Health Solutions
Research & development - Eindhoven | More than two weeks ago
Drive innovation in health solutions together with your team, industrial and academic partners.
Smart implants, interfaced by wearables will empower us towards a healthier lifestyle and towards the prevention of disease. At imec we have a track record of more than 15 years of building medical health solutions with leading worldwide customers and partners. We have grown to become a large and internationally recognized team and our ambition is to specifically expand our health development activities towards active medical devices.
Medical-grade technology, wearable and implantable, stands to revolutionize chronic disease management and will provide the caregiver and the patient with unprecedented insights and will enable precision medicine thanks to predictive personalized analytics. This requires the deployment of photonic, electronic, and other nanotechnology for sensors and actuation with the associated algorithms which can be implemented in new medical devices.
What you will do
Your work is at the crossroads of technology development, project management, technology proposal preparation, and business development. You will be responsible for a program that creates innovative solutions for diverse medical and health markets, which build on existing imec platforms for circuits, systems, algorithms, and technology. The focus of the work is to uplift the system and technology readiness levels (SRL & TRL) from fundamental research results built by your colleagues at imec to a market-ready result, to be taken over by imec’s partners.
In this role, you are in contact with prospects through the business pipeline and preparing technical proposals (scope, effort, time, cost) together with the Business Development Manager. At the same time, you are responsible for monitoring the timing, progress, and delivery of existing and new (internal and customer) projects. Particularly managing the execution of existing projects, guiding the execution handled by project managers, and being ultimately responsible for the deliverables and milestones for all ongoing projects in the group. In case of escalation of projects, you are the first point of contact for your project managers. You keep a close relationship with the team, which will provide input for proposal preparation and will be executing the projects.
Based on inputs from business development customer discussions and from our principal scientists, you will make technical proposals (schedule, cost, effort) for bilateral industrial R&D projects. Such proposals will be presented to customers together with the BDM.
You are responsible for managing the proper execution of the ongoing projects (timeline, cost, effort) by guiding an existing team of project leads. You are responsible for deliverables and milestones within the ongoing projects (scope owner) and need to make sure all projects are executed in-time and on budget.
You work together with Project Leaders, System Architects and Technical Experts in order to help in the proposal preparation and project execution tasks above.
Together with the Business Development Manager and the Program Directors, you are responsible to attract customers for this program and to meet the yearly department KPI’s.
In this role you motivate and challenge your team members to develop themselves and you encourage them to step out of their comfort zone.
You will act as a sounding board for the members of your team on both technical and organizational issues.
You are responsible for maintaining and further expanding the knowledge and expertise within the team. You indicate the necessary capacity to successfully execute projects.
You will report to the Program Director. Besides, you will have communication lines to other Program Managers in imec, to other Directors as well as Business Development Managers in The Netherlands and Belgium and to the regional sales team.
What we do for you
In exchange for your talent, passion and expertise, you will join a globally operating, renowned, multicultural and high-tech company, with challenges there for the taking. Our flexible, progressive and informal working environment offers you a range of possibilities to take initiative and show responsibility. This is your opportunity to contribute to the technology that will determine the society of tomorrow. imec supports and guides you in this process; not only with words but with concrete actions. Through imec academy, 'our corporate university', we are actively investing in the further development of all our employees to assure their technical and personal growth. Your valuable contribution and that of your colleagues make imec a top player in its field. Your energy and commitment are therefore appreciated by means of an attractive and competitive salary with many fringe benefits.
About imec
We offer you the opportunity to join one of the world’s premier research centers in nanotechnology at its location in Eindhoven, The Netherlands. With your talent, passion and expertise, you’ll become part of a team that makes the impossible possible. Together, we shape the technology that will determine the society of tomorrow.

We are proud of our open, multicultural, and informal working environment with ample possibilities to take initiative and show responsibility. We commit to supporting and guiding you in this process, not only with words but also with tangible actions. Through imec.academy, 'our corporate university', we actively invest in your development to further your technical and personal growth.
We are aware that your valuable contribution makes imec a top player in its field. Imec The Netherlands, as an employer of choice, offers you an attractive compensation and benefits package including a 100% employer paid pension plan and flexible working hours. Furthermore, imec-NL offers a wide range of training possibilities.
Who you are
You hold an Engineering or Scientific degree (Electrical, Electronics, Mechanics, Physics, Computer Science) combined with 10 years of managing research projects in a health-related field preferably with an affinity to semiconductors, electronic systems, algorithm development, and digital applications.
You have experience in running development projects in high tech ideally in the field of health, electronics, and power constraint applications.
Experience in proposal preparation within a technical field, for both customer- and funded projects.
You are willing and excited to discuss technical topics with customers and prospects.
You have a good human relationship with colleagues and a wider team.
Experience in medical device development or regulated development is a plus.
A motivational leader, helping the team go the extra mile.
You are a technically oriented individual who is able to coach, motivate and inspire team members to get the best out of themselves.
Experienced in influencing highly skilled employees in an R&D environment.
You are excellent at dealing with changing priorities.
Willingness to travel approximately 10% of the time.
Interested

Do you want to learn more about it, then you can connect with Frank Wolfs, Talent Acquisition Lead. You can reach Frank at +31(0)6 50 83 75 63 or frank.wolfs.ext@imec.nl. If you wish to apply, then please submit your full resume and a cover letter.

Eindhoven
In this role you will be working as a Nanofabrication Engineer, developing processes for the fabrication of superconducting devices. You will be working in close collaboration with academic personnel but also with dedicated experts from the industry.

| YOUR CHALLENGES?
In your role, you will integrate within a team and contribute to the development of robust processes for manufacturing quantum devices on diamond substrate.
| WHAT DO WE EXPECT FROM YOU?
Proficiency in working in cleanroom environment. Preferably knowledge of the following tools and processes:
Focus Ion Beam or Electron Beam Lithography
Wet bench processing
Sputtering, ALD, wire bonding
Measuring techniques (AFM, SEM...)
Ability to work in teams
Result oriented and dedicated to the project goals
Creativity
Ability to learn and assimilate new techniques or ideas.
| WHAT DOES OUR BUSINESS CELL HAVE TO OFFER?

TMC Nanotechnology consists of a close team of over 25 nanotechnologists with different levels of experience and background. Your colleagues will form the inner circle of you professional network, support you to find opportunities for yourself and facilitate your personal growth. Together with our Business manager we have a strong view on the nanotechnology market and demands.

Nanotechnologists at TMC are focusing on nanomaterials, thin films and nano- and microdevice development and production. With our expertise we help clients with project that have a strong impact in society.
Our multidisciplinary, pragmatic and entrepreneurial way of working provide innovative solutions for projects ranging from, design to research and development up to new product introduction.

| WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM TMC?

TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world.

At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in. We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career.

As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture.

| WHY CHOOSE FOR EMPLOYENEURSHIP?

We are truly unique thanks to our Employeneurship model which is a true innovation for the High Technology consulting business. It is the business relationship of the 21th century for high skilled technical professionals. It is built around 5 main pillars:

You will have a permanent employment contract, offering you stability and security
You will get to know your market value and have a share in the profit your work generates thanks to the individual profit sharing
We will support you with a one-on-one coaching and trainings designed to help you develop your entrepreneurial skills
The competence cells structure, provides you with a strong meaningful and relevant network
The entrepreneurial lab: a playground for new ideas and a potential launching for start-ups


TMC is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status

Feel Free to Contact
Thies Oosterwijk
Business manager Nanotechnology, Netherlands
Tel: +31 (0)6 54 93 80 45
pros: ["I have worked for TMC for over 13 years, and have felt supported, encouraged to grow, and cared about as an individual. I've never seen a company like this, where each individual team member is valued and never treated like just a number. TMC has high expectations for clinicians to provide the absolute best clinical care for the patients they serve, while offering them the training and resources to make that possible. TMC is a company of high integrity. They communicate openly with their team members to instill a culture of trust. Additionally, TMC has Together Making Changes, their non-profit charity organization that allows team members to give back in their community. I highly recommend this company to anyone who's looking to work for a company that values service and clinical excellence, integrity, innovation, and giving back.", 'I have been with TMC 7 years, they live out there WHY. It is not framed and on the wall, or stuffed in a file drawer. It truly is utiized to determine daily decisions of practice life.', 'this is a great career', 'Culture. Great support from upper management. Giving back of time, talent and treasures. Opportunities for growth in clinical excellence, management, and employee satisfaction team', "TMC has been my home for almost 8 years! I started as a new grad with so much support from my AM and coworkers. I have truly grown as a therapist and professional with so many opportunities for advancement. job_description:
Eindhoven
Als Process Engineer help je onze klant bij het ontwikkelen en fabriceren van hun nano- en micro-technologie producten door je handen toe te passen op technische kennis. en vaardigheden in multidisciplinaire teams.

| Your challenges?

Would you like to be one of the pioneers to build and expand a new R&D center in the field of chip integration, engaging with leading industries in automotive, healthcare technology and other high-tech sectors?
We are currently looking for a process engineer. You will be working at the interface of materials science, process technology, microelectronics and packaging in a multidisciplinary research environment, together with industry.

| What do we expect from you?
Develop interconnect and assembly processes for a next generation of high power device;
Participate with expertise and take responsibility in ongoing collaborative projects with international customers;
Interact with our industrial partners and customers on a day-to-day basis;
Preferably with 3 to 7 years of experience in semiconductor industry in the field of package development or assembly engineering;
Hands-on knowledge of package reliability requirements, failure analysis techniques and quality systems;
Excellent knowledge of assembly materials (die attach, passivation and encapsulation);
Hands-on mentality, able to organize practical work in efficient and cooperative way;
BSc degree in mechanical engineering, electrical engineering or materials science;
Knowledgeable with data handling, analysis and communication of results;
Good communication skills in English.

job_titles: Student project: Numerical simulation and validation of an electrochemical biofluid sensor
job_description:
Eindhoven
As an optical design engineer you can work in all areas of optics, using different techniques to design lasers, build telescopes, create fiber optics communication systems, and much more. You will be applying your expertise for different technical industries to innovate. So are you interest in optical engineering and development and a drive for technical innovation.

| Your challenges?

With TMC Physics, an optical expert is responsible for assisting our clients in the design, development, characterization or testing of optical systems. You will develop and maintain numerical models, design and conduct experiments and/or perform data analysis. The experimental setups involve various optical components such as mirrors, lasers, lenses, optical fibers or sensors. You will work in R&D environments on various application areas: projection, illumination, lighting applications, wafer optics, photonics. The work will mainly be conducted in project teams of various (technical) disciplines. It is crucial that you have a good overview of the possible applications of your expertise and that you’re able to motivate this to others.

| What do we expect from you?
MSc/PhD in (Applied) Physics or similar education;
Solid theoretical and experimental experience
Industrial experience in optical fibers, optical engineer and design, water optics
Experience with modeling, numerical methods, data analysis;
Experience with a combination of the following: Matlab, Zemax, LightTools, LabVIEW
Stress resistant;
Excellent oral and written communication skills, able to make clear recommendations to clients or suppliers;
Team player
Strong personality
Serious motivation for the Employeneurship model of TMC;
| What does our Business Cell have to offer?

The Employeneurs of TMC Physics are strongly driven by content. TMC Physics Employeneurs are internationally orientated, come from different cultures and are critical by nature. These are traits our customers like to put to their advantage. Within the team of physics competences in the field of computational physics, thermal and flow, optics/instrumentation/vision and plasma physics are represented among others.

| What can you expect from TMC?

TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world.

| Why choose for Employeneurship?

We are truly unique thanks to our Employeneurship model which is a true innovation for the High Technology consulting business. It is the business relationship of the 21th century for high skilled technical professionals. It is built around 5 main pillars:

You will have a permanent employment contract, offering you stability and security
